page.title: 07Communications in St. Levan.
page.content: {Porthcurno is part of the history of {telecommunications.}This quiet little cove provided an excellent landing and the shortest sea route for the{ {submarine telegraph cables }laid to Lisbon and Gibraltar in 1870, and later all over the world. During{World {War 2}the station was transferred to a tunnel dug into the side of the valley. When the telegraph station closed in 1970, the buildings and tunnels became entirely a training college.{This now offers some of the {finest facilites in international {telecommunications,}with more than 40 classrooms and labs which will cater for 150 students. Each student has to pay Â£500-00 a week to go to the college. This includes food and accomodation.
